snippet: President Obama’s unilateral shift on immigration policy is a signal to Hispanic voters that he is on their side, and a move that places Mitt Romney in a tough spot.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's unilateral shift on immigration policy is in many ways a bluntly political move, signaling to Hispanic voters that he is on their side while simultaneously placing Mitt Romney in a difficult position.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and TRIP GABRIEL
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Weisman, Jackie Calmes and Jeff Zeleny from Washington, and Sarah Wheaton from Milford, N.H.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s unilateral shift on immigration policy is a signal to Hispanic voters that he is on their side, and a move that places Mitt Romney in a tough spot.

headline.seo: Obama’s Immigration Shift Puts Pressure on Romney
headline.main: Obama’s Announcement Seizes Initiative and Puts Pressure on Romney
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Announcement Seizes Initiative and Puts Pressure on Romney

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject
